query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
1 Mentr’ io dubbiava per lo viso spento, 2 de la fulgida fiamma che lo spense 3 uscì un spiro che mi fece attento,
4 dicendo: «Intanto che tu ti risense 5 de la vista che haï in me consunta, 6 ben è che ragionando la compense.
query.result:
**English:**
1 While I was hesitating in the fading light, 2 from the radiant flame that extinguished it 3 came a breath that made me attentive,
4 saying: "While you are recovering 5 from the sight that you have lost in me, 6 it is right that you should compensate for it by reasoning.
**Sanskrit:**
1 Yāvad aham viṣādaṃ kurvan mūrcchita-darśanaḥ, 2 tasya dīptajvālāyāḥ yena sa mūrcchitaḥ, 3 tataḥ śvāsaḥ samutpannaḥ yasya hetoḥ aham avadhāna-yuktaḥ abhūvam,
4 uktavān: "Yāvad tvam darśana-śaktim prāpnuṣe ya mayi dīptā, 5 yuktam eva yathā tvam yukti-pūrvakam tām pūrayeḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
7 Comincia dunque; e dì ove s’appunta 8 l’anima tua, e fa ragion che sia 9 la vista in te smarrita e non defunta:
10 perché la donna che per questa dia 11 regïon ti conduce, ha ne lo sguardo 12 la virtù ch’ebbe la man d’Anania».
query.result:
**English:**
7 Begin then; and tell where your soul was directed, 8 and make reason your guide, since your sight 9 was lost and not extinguished in you:
10 for the lady who guides you through this savage 11 region has in her look 12 the power that Ananias' hand possessed.
**Sanskrit:**
7 Tasmāt praārambhaḥ kartavyas tava; kathaya ca kutra tava ātmā niyukta āsīt, 8 yuktiṃ ca pramāṇam kuru, yataḥ tava dṛṣṭiḥ naṣṭā āsīt na tu vināśam prāptā:
9 yataḥ iyam strī yā tvām imam durgamaṃ 10 deśam nayati, tasyāḥ dṛṣṭau 11 sā śaktiḥ asti yā Ananiyāḥ haste āsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
13 Io dissi: «Al suo piacere e tosto e tardo 14 vegna remedio a li occhi, che fuor porte 15 quand’ ella entrò col foco ond’ io sempr’ ardo.
query.result:
**English:**
13 I said: "At her pleasure, soon or late, 14 let there come a remedy for the eyes, which she took away 15 when she entered with the fire with which I always burn.
**Sanskrit:**
13 Ahaṃ vadāmi: "Tasyāḥ kāmena, kṣipram vā vilambitaṃ vā, 14 cakṣuṣoḥ pratikāraḥ āgacchatu, yat tayā apahṛtam āsīt, 15 yadā sā agnijvalena praviṣṭā āsīt, yena aham nityaṃ dīpyamānaḥ asmi."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
16 Lo ben che fa contenta questa corte, 17 Alfa e O è di quanta scrittura 18 mi legge Amore o lievemente o forte».
query.result:
**English:**
16 The good that makes this court content, 17 Alpha and Omega is of all scripture 18 Love reads to me, softly or loudly.
**Sanskrit:**
16 Yaḥ śubhaḥ ayam sabhāṃ tuṣṭām karoti, 17 Sarvasya śāstrasya ādiḥ antaś ca asti, 18 Mama premaḥ mṛduḥ kaṭhoraḥ vā pathate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
25 E io: «Per filosofici argomenti 26 e per autorità che quinci scende 27 cotale amor convien che in me si ’mprenti:
28 ché ’l bene, in quanto ben, come s’intende, 29 così accende amore, e tanto maggio 30 quanto più di bontate in sé comprende.
query.result:
**English:**
25 And I: "Through philosophical arguments 26 and through authority that descends from here, 27 such love must be imprinted in me:
28 because the good, insofar as it is understood as good, 29 thus kindles love, and all the more 30 the more goodness it comprises in itself.
**Sanskrit:**
25 Aham ca: "Tārkikais tarkaistathā 26 Atraiva yāvatīravārohaṇī śāstrīyā, 27 Tathāvidho 'yam mama sneho 'vasyam eva:
28 Yataḥ śubham, yāvat śubhatvena vijñāyate, 29 Tāvat sneham janayati, tataś ca 30 Yāvat tatra śubhatvam adhikaṃ tadvat."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
31 Dunque a l’essenza ov’ è tanto avvantaggio, 32 che ciascun ben che fuor di lei si trova 33 altro non è ch’un lume di suo raggio,
34 più che in altra convien che si mova 35 la mente, amando, di ciascun che cerne 36 il vero in che si fonda questa prova.
query.result:
**English:**
31 Therefore, in the essence where there is so much advantage, 32 that every good which is found outside of it 33 is nothing but a ray of its light,
34 more than in any other thing, it is fitting 35 that the mind, in loving, should be moved 36 of each one who discerns the truth on which this proof is founded.
**Sanskrit:**
31 Tasmāt tatra tattve yasminn evam atiśayaḥ, 32 yat sarvam śubham yat tasmād bahiḥ asti, 33 na kiñcid anyad asya prakāśasya raśmiḥ,
34 anyasmād atiriktam eva yuktam 35 manasaḥ premṇā calanam bhavati 36 pratyekasya vivecinasya, yena
37 tattvam avagamyate yasminn ayam pramāṇam ādhāryate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
37 Tal vero a l’intelletto mïo sterne 38 colui che mi dimostra il primo amore 39 di tutte le sustanze sempiterne.
query.result:
**English:**
37 Thus truly to my intellect he revealed 38 he who shows me the first love 39 of all eternal substances.
**Sanskrit:**
37 Tathā satyam mama buddhau prakāśate 38 saḥ yaḥ me prathamam prema darśayati 39 sarveṣām dhruvāṇām vastuṣām.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
40 Sternel la voce del verace autore, 41 che dice a Moïsè, di sé parlando: 42 ‘Io ti farò vedere ogne valore’.
query.result:
**English:**
40 The voice of the true Author resounded, 41 who, speaking of himself, said to Moses: 42 ‘I will show you every good thing’.
**Sanskrit:**
40 Satyasya kartur vāṇī prādurāsīt, 41 Yaḥ svayam āha Mośe’bhidhāya: 42 ‘Sarvaṃ śubhaṃ darśayāmi te’.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
43 Sternilmi tu ancora, incominciando 44 l’alto preconio che grida l’arcano 45 di qui là giù sovra ogne altro bando».
query.result:
**English:**
43 I laid me down again, beginning 44 the lofty proclamation that the mystery cries out 45 from here below over every other edict.
**Sanskrit:**
43 Punar ahaṃ niṣedhaṃ cakāra, ārabhya 44 ucchair nādaṃ yaḥ guhyam āha 45 atra adhastāt sarveṣām anyeṣām ādeśānām upari.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
46 E io udi’: «Per intelletto umano 47 e per autoritadi a lui concorde 48 d’i tuoi amori a Dio guarda il sovrano.
query.result:
**English:**
46 And I heard: "By human intellect 47 and by authority that agrees with it, 48 guard the sovereign of your loves for God.
**Sanskrit:**
46 Aham ca aśrauṣam: "Manuṣya-buddhyā 47 tathā tena saha anukūlayā āpta-vacanena 48 ātmanaḥ premaṇām īśvarāya rakṣa."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
49 Ma dì ancor se tu senti altre corde 50 tirarti verso lui, sì che tu suone 51 con quanti denti questo amor ti morde».
query.result:
**English:**
49 But tell me, do you feel other strings 50 pulling you towards him, so that you resound 51 with how many teeth this love bites you?
**Sanskrit:**
49 Api tu āha yadi tvam anyāḥ śreṇayaḥ 50 ākṛṣanti tvām tasya abhimukham, yathā tvam ghoṣaṃ kuruṣe 51 asya premaṇaḥ katibhiḥ dantaiḥ tvām daśati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
52 Non fu latente la santa intenzione 53 de l’aguglia di Cristo, anzi m’accorsi 54 dove volea menar mia professione.
query.result:
**English:**
52 The holy intention of the spire of Christ was not hidden, 53 indeed I realized 54 where it wanted to lead my profession.
**Sanskrit:**
52 Na latente āsīt śāntā abhiprāyaḥ 53 Agugliāyāḥ Kṛṣṭasya, anzi m’accorsi 54 Yatra netum icchati mama vyavasāyam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
55 Però ricominciai: «Tutti quei morsi 56 che posson far lo cor volgere a Dio, 57 a la mia caritate son concorsi:
58 ché l’essere del mondo e l’esser mio, 59 la morte ch’el sostenne perch’ io viva, 60 e quel che spera ogne fedel com’ io,
61 con la predetta conoscenza viva, 62 tratto m’hanno del mar de l’amor torto, 63 e del diritto m’han posto a la riva.
query.result:
**English:**
55 But I began again: "All those torments 56 that can turn the heart to God, 57 have concurred with my love:
58 for the existence of the world and my own existence, 59 the death that He suffered so that I might live, 60 and that which every faithful man hopes for, as I do,
61 with the aforesaid living knowledge, 62 have drawn me out of the sea of misguided love, 63 and have set me on the shore of the right path.
**Sanskrit:**
55 Tathāpi punar ārabdhaḥ: "Sarvāṇi tāni duḥkhāni 56 Yāni hṛdayam īśvare niyojayitum śaknuyur, 57 Mama premaṇi sammilitāni:
58 Yataḥ jagataḥ sattvam mama ca sattvam, 59 Mṛtyur yasya sahitā mama jīvanāya, 60 Yaś ca viśvasya bhaktajanasya āśāsti yathā mama,
61 Pūrvamuktābhijñānena jīvena, 62 Mām uddhṛtya mithyāpremaṇo 'mbudher, 63 Nyastavān satpathaḥtīre."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
64 Le fronde onde s’infronda tutto l’orto 65 de l’ortolano etterno, am’ io cotanto 66 quanto da lui a lor di bene è porto».
query.result:
**English:**
64 The leaves with which the eternal gardener 65 adorns his garden, I love so much 66 as the good that comes to them from him.
**Sanskrit:**
64 Patrāṇi yebhyaḥ sarvaṃ vāṭīṃ 65 vāṭīpālo nityaḥ alamkaroti, tāni aham tāvatprīṇāmi 66 yāvat tebhyaḥ tena śubhaṃ prayacchati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
67 Sì com’ io tacqui, un dolcissimo canto 68 risonò per lo cielo, e la mia donna 69 dicea con li altri: «Santo, santo, santo!».
query.result:
**English:**
67 As soon as I was silent, a most sweet song 68 resounded through the sky, and my lady 69 said with the others: "Holy, holy, holy!"
**Sanskrit:**
67 Yathā aham tuṣṭāvasam, madhuraḥ kācid gītiḥ 68 nabhasi pratisvarati sma, mama ca svāminī 69 anyaiḥ saha āha: "Pavitraḥ, pavitraḥ, pavitraḥ!"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
70 E come a lume acuto si disonna 71 per lo spirto visivo che ricorre 72 a lo splendor che va di gonna in gonna,
73 e lo svegliato ciò che vede aborre, 74 sì nescïa è la sùbita vigilia 75 fin che la stimativa non soccorre;
76 così de li occhi miei ogne quisquilia 77 fugò Beatrice col raggio d’i suoi, 78 che rifulgea da più di mille milia:
79 onde mei che dinanzi vidi poi; 80 e quasi stupefatto domandai 81 d’un quarto lume ch’io vidi tra noi.
query.result:
**English:**
70 And as at a sharp light one wakes 71 because of the visual spirit that runs 72 to the brightness that goes from skirt to skirt,
73 and the awakened one abhors what he sees, 74 so unaware is the sudden awakening 75 until the faculty of judgment comes to the rescue;
76 thus from my eyes every trifle 77 Beatrice banished with the ray of her eyes, 78 which shone from more than a thousand miles away:
79 whence I saw more then than I had seen before; 80 and almost stunned, I asked 81 about a fourth light that I saw among us.
**Sanskrit:**
70 Evaṃ ca tīkṣṇa prakāśe jāgarti 71 cakṣuḥsaṃjñābalāt yaḥ punar punar āgacchati 72 prakāśe yaḥ patalādhipatalaṃ gacchati,
73 jāgaritaśca yaṃ paśyati tad dveṣṭi, 74 tathā āścaryā bhavaty āsanna jāgaraṇaṃ 75 yāvat buddhiḥ saṃrakṣaṇaṃ na karoti;
76 evam mama netrābhyāṃ sarvāṃ kṣudrām vastum 77 Beatrice svakīya netrarasmibhiḥ apahṛtya 78 sahásra yोजनād api adhika prakāśamāne:
79 yataḥ aham pūrvam apy adhikaṃ apaśyam; 80 cañcalīkṛta iva aham papraccha 81 catuṣṭha prakāśaṃ yaṃ mayā madhye dṛṣṭaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
82 E la mia donna: «Dentro da quei rai 83 vagheggia il suo fattor l’anima prima 84 che la prima virtù creasse mai».
query.result:
**English:**
82 And my lady: "Within those rays 83 the soul first gazes upon its maker, 84 whom the first virtue ever created."
**Sanskrit:**
82 Eva ca mama patnī: "Antaḥ teṣām raśmīnām 83 svayam-kartāram ātmā paśyati prathamam, 84 yaḥ prathamam śaktim asṛjat kadācit."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
85 Come la fronda che flette la cima 86 nel transito del vento, e poi si leva 87 per la propria virtù che la soblima,
88 fec’ io in tanto in quant’ ella diceva, 89 stupendo, e poi mi rifece sicuro 90 un disio di parlare ond’ ïo ardeva.
query.result:
**English:**
85 Like the branch that bends its top 86 at the passing of the wind, and then rises 87 by its own virtue that lifts it up,
88 so did I, while she was speaking, 89 tremble, and then she made me secure again 90 with a desire to speak that burned within me.
**Sanskrit:**
85 Yathā śākhā śikharam namati 86 vātasya gatau, tataś ca uttiṣṭhati 87 svaguṇena yena sā utsedhyate,
88 tathā ahaṃ kṛtavān asmin samaye yāvad eva sā avocat, 89 kampamānaḥ, tataś ca punar mām niścitaṃ cakāra 90 kathana-kāṅkṣayā yena aham dīpyamānaḥ āsam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
91 E cominciai: «O pomo che maturo 92 solo prodotto fosti, o padre antico 93 a cui ciascuna sposa è figlia e nuro,
94 divoto quanto posso a te supplìco 95 perché mi parli: tu vedi mia voglia, 96 e per udirti tosto non la dico».
query.result:
**English:**
91 And I began: "O fruit that wast alone 92 produced mature, and ancient father, 93 to whom each spouse is daughter and daughter-in-law,
94 devoutly as I can I pray to thee 95 that thou wouldst speak to me: thou seest my desire, 96 and to hear thee soon I do not tell it."
**Sanskrit:**
91 Evamabravīmaham: "O phalam ya ekam eva 92 jātam paripākam prāptam asi, O pitarau prācīnau, 93 yābhyāṃ sarvāḥ patnīḥ putrīḥ putrvadhūśca bhavanti,
94 yathāśakti tava stutiṃ karomi 95 yathā mama vāñchāṃ vakṣyasi: mama vāñchāṃ tvam vetsi, 96 tat kathayitum mama tvareyuṇā na vakṣyāmi."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
109 Tu vuogli udir quant’ è che Dio mi puose 110 ne l’eccelso giardino, ove costei 111 a così lunga scala ti dispuose,
112 e quanto fu diletto a li occhi miei, 113 e la propria cagion del gran disdegno, 114 e l’idïoma ch’usai e che fei.
query.result:
**English:**
109 You want to hear how much God placed me 110 in the lofty garden, where this one 111 prepared you for such a long ascent,
112 and how much delight was in my eyes, 113 and the real cause of the great disdain, 114 and the language that I used and what I did.
**Sanskrit:**
109 Tvam śrotum icchasi yāvatīṃ mām devaḥ sthāpayām āsa 110 uttame udyāne, yatra ayam 111 tvām evam dīrghaṃ śreṇim prati niyojayām āsa,
112 ca yāvatī pritir āsīt mama netra-yugale, 113 ca svayam kāraṇaṃ mahato nirvedasya, 114 ca bhāṣāṃ yām aham prayojayām āsa ca kim aham akaravam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
115 Or, figluol mio, non il gustar del legno 116 fu per sé la cagion di tanto essilio, 117 ma solamente il trapassar del segno.
query.result:
**English:**
115 Now, my son, it was not the tasting of the tree 116 that was in itself the cause of such exile, 117 but only the transgression of the boundary.
**Sanskrit:**
115 Ataḥ, mama putra, kāṣṭhasya bhojanam 116 Na svataḥ eva etāvatyāḥ nirvāsanasya kāraṇam āsīt, 117 Kim tu sīmāyāḥ atilanghanam eva.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
124 La lingua ch’io parlai fu tutta spenta 125 innanzi che a l’ovra inconsummabile 126 fosse la gente di Nembròt attenta:
127 ché nullo effetto mai razïonabile, 128 per lo piacere uman che rinovella 129 seguendo il cielo, sempre fu durabile.
query.result:
**English:**
124 The language that I spoke was entirely forgotten 125 before the people of Nimrod attempted the unfinished work:
126 for no rational effect, 127 because of the human pleasure that is renewed 128 following the heavens, was ever lasting.
**Sanskrit:**
124 Yā bhāṣā mayā uktā sā sarvā naṣṭā 125 pūrvam eva yadā Nembrodhasya janāḥ 126 akṛtakāryam kāryam cakruḥ:
127 na hi kadācit kāraṇam yuktam 128 manuṣya-sukha-hetor yad abhyanavīkṛtam 129 svargam anugacchan sadā sthāyi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
130 Opera naturale è ch’uom favella; 131 ma così o così, natura lascia 132 poi fare a voi secondo che v’abbella.
query.result:
**English:**
130 It is natural for man to speak; 131 but in this way or that, nature leaves 132 it up to you to do as you please.
**Sanskrit:**
130 Prakṛtir eva naraḥ kathayati; 131 Tathāpi tathāpi prakṛtiḥ muñcati 132 Tataḥ kartavyam yathā yuşmabhyam abhimatam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
139 Nel monte che si leva più da l’onda, 140 fu’ io, con vita pura e disonesta, 141 da la prim’ ora a quella che seconda,
142 come ’l sol muta quadra, l’ora sesta».
query.result:
**English:**
139 On the mountain that rises highest from the waves, 140 I was, with life pure and impure, 141 from the first hour to that which follows it,
142 as the sun changes quadrant, the sixth hour.
**Sanskrit:**
139 Yasmāt parvataḥ udgacchati adhikaḥ taraṅgāt, 140 Āsam aham jīvanena śuddhena ca aśuddhena ca, 141 Prathamāt samayaḥ yāvat tadanantaram,
142 Yathā sūryaḥ parivartate catuṣkoṇaḥ, ṣaṣṭhaḥ samayaḥ.
